questions.question_text: What are two benefits of using forward error correction (FEC) in IPsec VPNs? (Choose two.)

choices.C: FEC transmits parity packets that can be used to reconstruct packet loss.
choices.B: FEC improves reliability of noisy links.
choices.D: FEC can leverage multiple IPsec tunnels for parity packets transmission.

questions.question_text: Which two tasks are part of using central VPN management? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A and D are correct
Study guide page 57 and 59

Answer is A and D
Study guide page 57 and 59

choices.B: You must enable VPN zones for SD-WAN deployments.
choices.C: FortiManager installs VPN settings on both managed and external gateways.
choices.D: You configure VPN communities to define common IPsec settings shared by all VPN gateways.
choices.A: You can configure full mesh, star, and dial-up VPN topologies.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B and D are correct
Study Guide 7.0 Page 90

choices.B: During passive monitoring, FortiGate can’t detect dead members.
choices.A: After FortiGate switches to active mode, FortiGate never fails back to passive monitoring.
choices.D: FortiGate passively monitors the member if TCP traffic is passing through the member.
choices.C: FortiGate can offload the traffic that is subject to passive monitoring to hardware.

choices.D: The traffic shaper limits the bandwidth of each source IP to a maximum of 6250 KBps.
choices.B: The measured bandwidth is less than 100 KBps.
choices.A: The traffic shaper drops packets if the bandwidth is less than 2500 KBps.
choices.C: The traffic shaper drops packets if the bandwidth exceeds 6250 KBps.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B. The measured bandwidth is less than 100 KBps.
C. The traffic shaper drops packets if the bandwidth exceeds 6250 KBps.
